result.execSummary:
The defendant John W. Costello was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Restitution to be determine, if any.

Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.

Write a letter of apology to the victim due within 30 days of sentencing and pre-approved by the agent.
Undergo counseling as deemed appropriate by the agent and follow through with recommendations.
AODA assessment and follow through with treatment recommended.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John W. Costello

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: In Court Notice to Defendant After Sentencing

Defendant John W. Costello in court.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreement placed on record by Ms. Tlusty.  Advised of right to counsel - freely, intelligently, and voluntarily waived at these proceedings. State moved to amend the charge to disorderly conduct per 947.01 - granted by the court.  DE entered a plea of no contest to the amended charge.  Plea colloquy.  Court found plea given freely, voluntarily, and intelligently; accepted plea; found DE guilty and ordered entry of JOC.  Brief comments by Ms. Tlusty.  No further comments by DE.  Court withheld sentence and ordered probation for one year with the following conditions:  payment of court costs and DNA surcharge; letter of apology to the victim within 30 days and pre-approved by agent; restitution, if any, AODA and comply with treatment recommendations; and counseling as deemed appropriate by agent.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 3, 2014 at 11:30 am.
Status conference on September 16, 2014 at 03:45 pm.
Status conference on September 16, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

Defendant John W. Costello in court.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Advised of charges/penalties; of right to counsel.  DE directed to contact SPD.  Court advised DE of right to a timely preliminary hearing.  Time limits waived and matter set for a PTC.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 13, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Victim Request and Order to Remove No Contact from Defendant's Bond

*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Defendant shall comply with booking procedures at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department.  Defendant shall have no contact with A.H. -dob: 2-21-80.

District Attorney Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  John Costello appeared in person, in custody.  Court finds probable cause for arrest without warrant based on the arrest header.  Court advised defendant of right to an attorney.  Notice of right to an attorney given to defendant.  Attorney Tlusty requested $500.00 cash bond; no contact with A.H.  Court orders $500.00 cash bond; booking and no contact with A.H.  Initial appearance scheduled for July 15, 2014 at 1:00 p.m.  - rt
